value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/tONOosN1xAs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #05: Remove table filters
value.excerpt: Don't remove filters from tables when you want to remove column filters. Learn the difference and fix your DAX formulas! value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #06: Using ALLSELECTED
value.excerpt: Learn how to correctly use ALLSELECTED in CALCULATE to compare a number with visual totals. value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Introducing DEFINE TABLE in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE TABLE statement in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx

value.title: DAX Fridays! #183: How to deal with multiple dates in Power BI
value.excerpt: So you have order date, shipped date, required date....and only one calendar. How do you manage that in power bi and DAX? value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax
